intro: Prunella hirta, commonly known as selfheal, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces blue to purple flowers in whorls along the stem, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils. Prunella hirta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its healing qualities.
